rules.summary: KL University has strict academic, conduct, hostel, and institutional rules that students must follow.

academic_conduct.attendance: A minimum of 85% attendance is mandatory for all courses to be eligible for semester-end examinations.
academic_conduct.evaluation: In-semester evaluations contribute a maximum of 50% to the total marks. Answer scripts are shown to students for verification.
academic_conduct.integrity: Students must maintain academic integrity and avoid malpractice in examinations.

code_of_conduct.discipline: Strict silence and discipline must be maintained in classrooms, laboratories, and academic areas.
code_of_conduct.prohibited: Ragging, smoking, alcohol consumption, and any form of indiscipline are strictly prohibited on campus.
code_of_conduct.dress_code: Students are required to wear the prescribed uniform and follow the official dress code.

hostel_rules.prohibited_items: Electrical appliances such as water heaters are strictly banned. Violations attract a fine of ₹500.
hostel_rules.laptops: Laptops are permitted only for academic purposes.
hostel_rules.damages: Students are responsible for damages to hostel property, and repair costs will be recovered.

other_regulations.library_mess: Misuse of library or mess property leads to fines ranging from ₹100 to ₹300.
other_regulations.identity_cards: Students must carry their identity cards at all times on campus.
other_regulations.vehicles: Students must follow designated parking and vehicle regulations.

fees.summary: KL Deemed to be University fee structure varies based on program, campus, and facilities.

btech.hyderabad: B.Tech (4 years) fees at Hyderabad campus range from approximately ₹10.96 Lakhs to ₹12.16 Lakhs depending on specialization.

mba.guntur: MBA fees at Guntur campus range from ₹4.5 Lakhs (Standard MBA) to ₹10 Lakhs (Global Management program) annually.

fees.ug_programs: Other undergraduate program fees range from approximately ₹6.46 Lakhs to ₹12.16 Lakhs.
fees.pg_programs: Postgraduate program fees are approximately ₹9.15 Lakhs depending on the course.

hostel.guntur: Hostel fees at Guntur campus range from ₹80,000 to ₹1.8 Lakhs per year depending on room type and AC/Non-AC facilities.

hostel_rules.summary: KL University hostel rules emphasize discipline, safety, punctuality, and responsible behavior among residents.

timings_attendance.first_year: First-year students must be inside the hostel by 3:00 PM.
timings_attendance.seniors: Senior students must return to the hostel by 6:00 PM.
timings_attendance.study_hours: Mandatory study hours are from 7:30 PM to 10:30 PM, during which students must remain in their rooms.

hostel_rules.visitors: Visitors are allowed only in the visitors' hall with prior warden permission and only until 7:30 PM. Visitors are not permitted inside hostel rooms.
hostel_rules.prohibited_items: Electrical appliances such as stoves, heaters, and irons are strictly banned. Alcohol, drugs, cigarettes, and gutka are strictly prohibited.
hostel_rules.property_safety: Students must lock their rooms and deposit keys with security when leaving. Any damage to hostel property will attract a fine double the cost of the damage.
hostel_rules.conduct: Ragging is strictly prohibited and may result in expulsion. Noise-free, approved in-room celebrations are allowed, but partying is not permitted.
hostel_rules.meals: Food must be consumed only in the dining hall. Taking food to rooms is not permitted.
hostel_rules.loss_liability: The management is not responsible for the loss of personal belongings such as cash or laptops.

administrative.fee_payment: Hostel fees must be paid on or before the 5th of every month.
administrative.room_allotment: Rooms are allotted on a first-come, first-served basis.
administrative.vacating: Mid-year or premature vacating of hostel rooms does not entitle students to any refund.
